importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date when Kada Scott went missing and the Hyundai Accent was reported stolen, a key timeline point in the investigation.
The date when the anonymous tip led investigators back to the school site and led to the discovery of Scott's remains.
The date of the news update and official announcement of the remains discovery and charges against Keon King.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The period during which the stolen Hyundai Accent was reported stolen and later found on fire, connecting to the timeline of Scott's disappearance.
The time when the second tip led investigators to the site where Scott's remains were found, marking a critical turning point in the case.

keyTakeAways: The remains of Kada Scott, a 23-year-old woman missing for about two weeks, were found in a shallow grave behind an abandoned school in Philadelphia.
Keon King, 21, of Dover, Delaware, has been arrested and charged with kidnapping, stalking, arson, causing or risking a catastrophe, conspiracy, and possibly homicide.
DNA testing confirmed the identity of the remains as belonging to Kada Scott.
King's cellphone was tracked to locations related to Scott’s disappearance, and a stolen Hyundai Accent was found on fire near where the remains were discovered.
The car, reported stolen one day before Scott disappeared, was seen parked at a recreation center on the evening of October 4, 2025.
The vehicle was later found on fire and compacted at a junkyard, preventing detailed examination.
Authorities believe other individuals may have been involved after the fact, and that investigation is ongoing.
Prosecutors say homicide charges are likely, but emphasize legal process and constitutional obligations must be followed.
King was previously arrested in a separate case involving kidnapping and assault, though charges were dropped due to non-appearance of witnesses.
Kada Scott, who worked at an assisted living facility, was remembered by her parents as kind and full of light; they described their hearts as 'shattered' by her disappearance.

namedEntities.name: Kada Scott
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A 23-year-old woman who went missing in Philadelphia and whose remains were later discovered behind an abandoned school.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: She is the central figure in the case—her disappearance and subsequent body discovery drive the narrative and legal proceedings.

namedEntities.name: Keon King
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A 21-year-old man from Dover, Delaware, arrested and charged with multiple crimes in connection with Kada Scott’s disappearance.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He is the primary suspect in the case, with evidence linking his movements and actions to Scott’s disappearance and the stolen car fire.

namedEntities.name: Philadelphia

namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: It is the geographic and jurisdictional setting of the case, where law enforcement, legal proceedings, and public response occurred.

namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: It provides context for King’s location and background, which may be relevant to understanding potential ties to the crime.

namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: It serves as a physical link between King and Scott’s disappearance, with video evidence showing it parked near where Scott was found.

namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: It provides context for her daily life and the circumstances of her disappearance after an overnight shift.

summaryOfNewsArticle: In Philadelphia, the remains of 23-year-old woman Kada Scott, who had been missing for about two weeks, were discovered in a shallow grave behind an abandoned school. Authorities say the discovery was prompted by an anonymous tip that led them to re-examine the site. DNA tests confirmed her identity. Keon King, a 21-year-old man from Dover, Delaware, has been arrested and charged with kidnapping, stalking, arson, conspiracy, and possibly homicide. Evidence shows King’s cellphone was active in locations tied to Scott’s disappearance, and a stolen black Hyundai Accent was seen parked near the site on the evening of October 4, 2025. The car was later found on fire and destroyed at a junkyard. Prosecutors believe other individuals may have been involved after the fact and are still investigating. While King was previously arrested in a separate case, charges were dropped due to witness non-appearance. Scott’s parents described her as a source of kindness and light, and expressed deep grief over her disappearance.
title: Remains Found Behind Abandoned School Belong to Missing Philadelphia Woman, Kada Scott
